comments.content: The hallway fight scene is definitely my favorite! The way they played with gravity was mind-blowing.
I love the ending! The spinning top keeps me guessing every time.
The scene where they're floating in the hotel is iconic. The practical effects were amazing!
The character development in this film is so well done. Each person has their own motivations and arc.
Hans Zimmer's score elevates every scene. The 'Time' track still gives me chills!
The social commentary is so relevant. The contrast between the two families is brilliantly portrayed.
The twist in the middle completely changed the tone of the film. Masterful direction!
Marlon Brando's performance as Don Corleone is one of the greatest in cinema history.
The baptism scene intercut with the assassinations is pure cinematic genius.
The diner scene with Jules and Vincent is my favorite. The dialogue is so natural yet memorable.
The way Tarantino plays with chronology makes the film so engaging. You have to piece it together.
Heath Ledger's Joker is terrifying because he's so unpredictable. A truly iconic performance.
